io.spine.server

Class BoundedContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.BoundedContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.spine.logging.Logging, Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public abstract class BoundedContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements Closeable, io.spine.logging.Logging
    A logical and structural boundary of a model.

    Logically, a Bounded Context represents a sub-system built to be described with the same Ubiquitous Language. Any term within a single bounded context has a single meaning and may or may not map to another term in the language of another Bounded Context.

    The Ubiquitous Language of a Bounded Context is represented by such concepts as the entity state, event, and command types, entity types, and others. An entity and its adjacent types belong to the Bounded Context which the entity Repository is registered in.

    Structurally, a Bounded Context brings together all the infrastructure required for the components of a model to cooperate.

    An instance of BoundedContext acts as a major point of configuration for all the model elements which belong to it.

    See Also:
    Martin Fowler on Bounded Contexts

      • init

        protected final void init()
        Performs post-creation initialization of the instance.

        This method must be called shortly after the constructor so that the instance can perform dependency injections steps that cannot be performed in the constructor.

      • registerEventDispatcher

        protected void registerEventDispatcher(EventDispatcher dispatcher)
        Registering the passed event dispatcher with the buses of this context.

        If the passed instance dispatches domestic events, registers it with the EventBus. If the passed instance dispatches external events, registers it with the IntegrationBroker.

        See Also:
        BoundedContext.registerEventDispatcher(EventDispatcherDelegate)

      • hasEntitiesOfType

        public boolean hasEntitiesOfType(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity<?,?>> entityClass)

        This method does not take into account visibility of entity states.

      • name

        public io.spine.core.BoundedContextName name()
        Obtains an ID of the Bounded Context.

        The ID allows to identify a Bounded Context if a multi-context application. If the ID was not defined during the building process, the Bounded Context gets BoundedContextNames.assumingTests() name.

        Returns:
        the ID of this BoundedContext

      • spec

        Obtains specification of this context.

        public boolean isMultitenant()
        Returns true if the Bounded Context is designed to serve more than one tenant of the application, false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Closes the BoundedContext performing all necessary clean-ups.

        This method performs the following:

        1. Closes associated StorageFactory.
        2. Closes CommandBus.
        3. Closes EventBus.
        4. Closes IntegrationBroker.
        5. Closes EventStore.
        6. Closes Stand.
        7. Closes ImportBus.
        8. Closes TracerFactory if it is present.
        9. Closes all registered repositories.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - caused by closing one of the components

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Description copied from interface: Closeable
        Tells if the object is still open.

        Implementations must return false after AutoCloseable.close() is invoked.

        Specified by:
